result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R. Ackerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with N.A. unless approved by probation ro party.

SAFE program
Random UAs

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes:
Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  

Any oustanding fees and costs are to be paid as condition of ES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R. Ackerman

records.addlTxt:
Plea and Sentencing and Sentencing after Revocation Hearing
Judge Falstad
Dec. 21st 2017

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:24am
INCLUDES 15CF177, 15CF279, 17CM1494
State appears by ADA Davis Runde. Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Camille Silliman
Date and time set for SAR in 15CF177 & 15CF279 and plea in 17CM1494

** SAR in 15CF177 & 15CF279 **
Parties make argument on sentencing recommendation.
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 15CF177 Ct. 1 Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g)- repeater- 2nd/sub. drug off: 4 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 2 years ES. Ct. 2 Maintain Drug Trafficking Place- repeater: 4 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 2 years ES. 302 days credit granted. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge the DNA sample is already on file. Any outstanding fees and costs are to be paid as condition of ES. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF279 Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- domestic abuse: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 223 days credit granted. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent.Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge the DNA sample is already on file. Any outstanding fees and costs are to be paid as condition of ES.
Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration 
ALL SENTENCES to be concurrent to one another & concurrent to 17CM1494 Ct. 1 jail sentence. 
COURT will allow huber release for work, work search, or treatment if meets jail criteria if deft is going to be held in County Jail instead of Prison.

** PLEA in 17CM1494 ** 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Battery- repeater >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Serve 1 year MCJ, concurrent to SAR's - 15CF177 Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 and 15CF279 Ct. 2. 112 days credit granted. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and sample is already on file at MCSD. 

Adj: 10:49am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:36am
INCLUDES 15CF177, 15CF279, 17CM1494
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Camille Silliman.
Date and time was set for SAR in 15CF177 & 15CF279 & plea in 17CM1494

State needs confer with victim first before proceeding with SAR & plea's today
Atty Silliman is in agreement with adjourning all matters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 1:07pm. INCLUDES 15CF177, 15CF279, 15CF290. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Waiver of Prelim. filed 15CF177. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information filed 15CF77. COURT proceeds with Plea. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 3 & 4 (poss drug para/repeater) 15CF177- crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 1 (bj/felony/repeater) 15CF279. State moves to DRI 15CF290-crt grants.
PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1 (manfacture/deliver/second & subsequent); ct 2 (maintain drug traffic/repeater) 15CF177; ct 2 (dc/repeater/domestic) 15CF279. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense.  COURT ORDERS: SWH 2 yrs probation, concurrent. CONDITITIONS: 6 months MCJ on ct 2; Impose & Stay 3 months jail for rule violations w/huber if eligible purusant to jail criteria; credit 69 days; AODA; SAFE Progream; Absolute Sobriety; Random UA's; 50 hours Community Service; No Contact with N.A. unlesss approved by probation or party; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; 1 Domestic Surcharge; Court Costs;  DNA Sample & Surcharge for felony.  Atty Bohn moves to remit DNA Surcharge 15CF279- COURT grants. Crt advises and defendant sign Ineligible Voting Form. Adjourned: 1:30pm.

Case Called: 1:30pm. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 15CF290, 15CD177, 15CF279. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Lou Ann Bohn. Matter set on Mtn to Amend Bond on 15CF290. Arguments. COURT makes findings and denies bond modification.  DATES: Set further dates.  Adjourned: 1:37pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  N.A.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  No controlled substances or alcohol without valid prescription.  Absolute sobriety unless valid prescription for medications.
